about.aboutContent:
High volumes of traffic in the National and Provincial Parks across Canada has had a positive impact on Canadian tourism. After last years celebrations of Canada 150, where all the public was granted free access to the National Parks across the country, one must ask themselves how these increased numbers have affected the park, its resources and the natural beauty around us. With large areas and minimal Park’s staff, it has become increasingly more difficult to properly monitor and maintain the Parks for the increasing traffic flow. High costs and unrealistic manhours would be associated with obtaining all the necessary information about the trails and recreation areas within the Parks.  

Why not use the increasing numbers of the public to aid in collection of real time data through trail, wildlife and facility reports? Introducing TrailCrew, a mobile and desktop application that brings together outdoor enthusiasts with Parks staff to help report Park issues. The goal of this application is for better delegation of Park resources and up to date information on trails and park facilities in the area.
